history.content: I guess the answer technically depends on what "something else" you would be doing, but if you think you might be interested in doing research in deep reinforcement during grad school you should consider 294-112 very seriously.  In general, taking a grad class and doing a research project is a better preparation for grad school than taking some other (non-foundational) class, and this is particularly true if it's your area of interest.  Plus, Berkeley is uniquely strong in deep RL and you'll be learning from some of the best.

Hi. I'm currently a 4th year undergrad, and I got off the waitlist for CS 294-112 (Deep Reinforcement Learning). The course seems really cool, and I would only do it for 1-2 units (graded) anyway.

But, is it worth spending the time in this course and doing the end of the semester research project if I'm thinking about grad school? If I do end up going to grad school, I'd probably be doing research in this field. Or am I better off spending my time doing something else? I'm already involved in my own research project (also in the field of AI/ML) with another grad student.

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: CS 294-112 Useful for Grad School
